intro: Pycnarrhena fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered inflorescence of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Pycnarrhena fasciculata is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
